newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Bangchak awards 1.0 mln bbls Murban in June tender.
newsitem.headline: Bangchak awards 1.0 mln bbls Murban in June tender.

text.p: Bangchak Petroleum Plc has awarded one million barrels of Murban crude in its June buying tender, industry sources said on Wednesday.
It awarded the barrels to Mitsubishi Corp on a Dubai pricing basis +$1.50 to $1.60 per barrel.
However, a refinery source said the refinery was valuing the Dubai-related price at the equivalent of ADNOC -20 cents.
Sources said the refiner may have taken at least one, but possible two other cargoes in the tender. The refiner declined to give details.

A source at the 120,000 barrels-per-day refinery said Bangchak did not plan to buy any regional light sweet grades in June because the Murban purchases now provided it with enough light grades for the month.
In its May buying tender, Bangchak awarded 750,000 barrels of Al Shaheem crude.
